definition: rebel faction
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: The rebels defiantly welcomed new allies and laid plans for unionization campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 造反派熱烈歡迎新盟友，並制訂組織工會的計劃。

sentences.english: The rebel factions made common cause to overthrow the regime.
sentences.chinese: 各造反派聯合起來共同推翻政府。
造反派戰士和囚犯相互輝映。

sentences.english: The rebels occupied the post office.
The subjection of the rebels took a long time.
sentences.chinese: 征服這些造反派花了很長時間。

sentences.english: US military helicopter has gone down northwest of Baghdad with Sunni insurgents tied to Al-Qaeda claiming responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 與阿爾蓋達組織有聯繫的遜尼造反派稱對其負責。

sentences.english: The leaders of the revolt made important changes.
sentences.chinese: 造反派的領導做出重要改變。

definition: Red Guards (Cultural Revolution, 1966-1976)
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)
capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
counterrevolutionary
rightist elements
Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
reactionaries/reactionary elements
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
Cultural Revolution (1966-1976)
persons or faction in authority
(political) right/right wing/rightist
bad element/bad egg
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
reactionaries
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Zhang Chunqiao (1917-2005), one of the Gang of Four
